definition: abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: B. Sc. , Department of Physics, University of Nanjing, June 1965.
sentences.chinese: 1965年畢業於南京大學物理系核物理專業。

sentences.english: The Nanjing University Professor Zhi-Hua Zhou proposed the concept of selective ensemble learning.
sentences.chinese: 南京大學周志華教授提出選擇性集成學習的概念。

sentences.english: Jun Liu, Professor of Harvard University, US.
sentences.chinese: 陳洪淵，中國科學院院士，南京大學教授。

sentences.english: Do Nanjing University Pu Kou school area have the clean point moon rent house nearby?
sentences.chinese: 南京大學浦口校區附近有沒有乾淨點的月租房？

sentences.english: Department of Polymer Sci. and Eng. , School of Chem. and Chem. Eng.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎報考南京大學化學化工學院高分子研究生。

sentences.english: He is now the professor and vice-dean of the School of Architecture, Nanjing University.
sentences.chinese: 現爲南京大學建築學院副院長，教授及博士生導師。

sentences.english: Eventually, Xia Peng, from Nanjing University was named the champion.
sentences.chinese: 最終，來自南京大學的夏鵬獲得了比賽的冠軍。
